oai_dc:dc.dc:title: DIVERSITY ORIENTED APPROACH TO OXEPINE DERIVATIVES: FURTHER EXPANSION VIA DIELS-ALDER REACTION
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: KOTHA, S
ALI, R
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: MARINE NATURAL-PRODUCTS
KEY STEPS
CLAISEN REARRANGEMENT
ORGANIC-SYNTHESIS
OLEFIN METATHESIS
ENYNE METATHESIS
CYCLIC ETHERS
STRATEGY
TOXINS
RING
Oxepine
Diels-Alder Reaction
Rongalite
Sultine
Alkylation Reaction
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Oxepine derivatives have been assembled via Diels-Alder (DA) reaction as a key step and the latent dienes suitable for the DA reaction have been generated in situ from the sultine derivatives, which in turn were achieved by using commercially available rongalite. The "drug like" molecules assembled here may find useful applications in medicinal as well as bioorganic chemistry.
